meta_info.selection_reason: After yesterday's earnings announcement, plunged over 8% intraday today with a surge in volume, S&P500 hot loser.

seo.title: AKAM Drops 8% After Earnings? Should You Really Sell?
seo.meta_description: Earnings were good yesterday, so why did AKAM drop 8% today? Honest review of why the guidance was cut and what’s next.
seo.author: Research Team

hook_summary.heading: 3-Second Investment Key Summary
points: Earnings were good but 2026 guidance was cut, so it plunged 8% today.
Institutions dumped shares, causing volume to explode to 10x normal levels.
Better to watch now; it’s oversold but risks remain high.

content.excerpt: Let’s look at why AKAM dropped so much after earnings today and the chances of revaluation going forward. Earnings were good but guidance was the issue.

sections.heading: Market today_story: Why is AKAM Moving?
sections.content: Wow.. the market went crazy today after yesterday's earnings release, right? Earnings beat expectations, but the 2026 outlook came in below analyst estimates, so investors sold off. There’s no policy risk, but the market narrative is about intensifying competition in the cloud market.

sections.heading: Recent price talk & Momentum
sections.content: Looking at the chart, it slightly rose after hours yesterday but started a straight drop from this morning. While the whole tech sector is shaky, AKAM was hit harder due to guidance. Seems like an overcorrection compared to the sector.

sections.heading: Key Catalysts & Risk Factors
sections.content: Catalysts are strong growth in security business and AI inference cloud. But margin pressure risk rose due to expected capex increase. Being sensitive to interest rate moves, macro uncertainty also adds to risks.

sections.heading: Recent news talk & Developments
sections.content: Headline is 'Akamai beats earnings but disappoints on guidance.' Investors reacted coldly to news about raising capex for AI investment. Institutional data isn’t out yet but we see large sell-off traces.

sections.heading: Institutional & Insider Activity
sections.content: Trading volume surged massively vs usual. Large institutional selling pressure seems strong. No insider info yet, but following whale moves is good during sharp drops.

sections.heading: Investment Plan (3–12 Months)
sections.bull_case: If guidance is exceeded, re-rating is possible via AI cloud scaling. Continued strong security sales growth could push past $100.
sections.bear_case: If capex burden grows, margins shrink, and if tech rotation drags on, the stock could fall further.
sections.strategy: Full bet now is risky. Enter in 10% chunks during oversold phases and buy on rebound signals. In one line? Watch first, then average down timing.

faq.question: Earnings were good, so why is it falling?
faq.answer: Guidance missed expectations. Investors see higher capex as more money going out.

faq.question: Is it okay to buy now?
faq.answer: It may fall more, so wait for a rebound. Keep an eye if it goes below $80.
